section.translation[0].definitions[0].de: one of the parts that something such as an object or place is divided into
section.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The plane’s tail section was found in a cornfield.
the smoking section  (=where you can smoke)
the reference section of the library
section.translation[0].definitions[1].de: one of the separate parts of a structure, piece of furniture etc that you fit together to form the whole
section.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The boats were built in Scotland, and transported to Egypt in sections.
section.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a separate part of a book, newspaper, document, report etc
section.translation[0].definitions[2].no: sports/style/business/travel etc section (=particular part of a newspaper)
section.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: This issue will be discussed further in section two.
section.translation[0].definitions[3].de: a separate group within a larger group of people
section.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: a large section of the American public
section.translation[0].definitions[4].de: one of the parts of a law or a legal document
section.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: Article I, Section 8 of the US Constitution
section.translation[0].definitions[5].de: a picture that shows what a building, part of the body etc would look like if it were cut from top to bottom or side to side
section.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: Here’s the outside view, and here are the floors in section.
section.translation[0].definitions[6].de: a medical operation that involves cutting
section.translation[0].definitions[7].de: a very thin flat piece that is cut from skin, a plant etc to be looked at under a microscope
section.translation[0].definitions[8].de: a square area of land in the US that is one mile long on each side
section.translation[0].definitions[9].de: the shape that is made when a solid figure is cut by a flat surface in mathematics
section.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to officially force someone with a mental illness to go to a psychiatric hospital, because they are dangerous to themselves or other people
section.translation[1].definitions[2].de: to cut a very thin flat piece from skin, a plant etc so that you can look at it under a microscope
section.translation[1].definitions[3].de: to cut a part of the body in a medical operation
section.translation[2].definitions[0].de: one of the parts of an organization or department
section.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: You will need to speak to the manager of the marketing services section.
Toyota suffered its biggest drop in profit since its sales and manufacturing sections merged.
section.translation[2].definitions[1].de: one of the parts of a document, book, newspaper etc
section.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: The lease qualifies for special protection under section 11 of the Bankruptcy Code.
I usually read the business section of the newspaper first.
